brief_description of the content in the: The source URL describes a rule that checks for classes annotated with @Path but do not have any resource methods. The root resource class should have at least one resource method annotated with @Path or any of the @HttpMethod annotations such as @GET, @POST, etc.
generated_rule_explanation from GPT-4: The rule 'pathClassWithoutResourceMethods' checks for all classes in the project. If a class is annotated with @Path, it asserts that there exists at least one method in the class that is annotated with @Path, @GET, or @POST. If this condition is not met, it generates a message stating that the class annotated with @Path does not have any resource methods.
